5.5.21  3:15 am   hi bill, i've written a few songs, but i want to be able to write short 'jingles' like you do. how do you come up with those short but memorable melodies?

     do you just sing/play random notes,

     or whichever notes you feel will sound good by intuition?

      or do you apply some theory of which scale degree you want the melody to go to next?

      my guess is that you probably use a mix of the two, because that's how i write my songs too. but are there any specific tips you have just for writing these short jingles?

sorry for the long and winding question

5.4.21  5:45 pm   is "i'm a princess" about the texas winter crisis?

     i lived through it, and i drew a lot of connections. for one, when you said/sang "buckets catch the dreams as they fall from my ceiling", it perfectly described what happened in my house. a sprinkler pipe burst, and water poured from the ceiling. we had to use buckets to catch the water, and all the good dreams. another one is when you said/sang "and i wonder about my neighbors even though i don't have them. but they're listening to every word i say" also accurately described how my mom's friends had to go to other house to stay safe, and their neighbors were listening to their problems. and for the final connection, "oops there goes the ceiling", one girl's ceiling fell down because of the sudden freeze. mine was removed because of the freeze as well. so, to reiterate, was "i'm a princess" about the texas thingy?

     or were the connections coincidental?

5.4.21  2:06 am   your reality videos are a huge inspiration for me, and i tell all my friends that are trying to deal with creative blocks for it, and has been a huge help! if we look at this perspective, you are one of the greatest minds i've ever seen for getting mentally better at creative explorativeness. my question here is, do you ever consider posting un-edited raw reality footage,

     (i don't know how do you keep them when they are un-edited, but it seems like you have lots of voice recordings where you... just talk?) i know that the edit makes them pretty better, but for a quick-fix for us until you can post more of them, i think a lot of people would still be interested in that format as well!, love your work!
